verses.roman:
ākāra nā dekhi, mātra śuni tāra gāna'
svarūpa kahena,--"ei mithyā anumāna

synonyms: ākāra—form; nā dekhi—we cannot see; mātra—only; śuni—we hear; tāra—his; gāna—singing; svarūpa kahena—Svarūpa Dāmodara said; ei—this; mithyā—false; anumāna—guess.
translation: "We cannot see his material form," they said, "but still we hear his sweet singing. Therefore he must have become a ghost." Svarūpa Dāmodara, however, protested, "This is a false guess.
